channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI-driven layoffs are shrinking the job market for recent grads
item.description: AI is becoming a major driver of workforce reductions, with over 10,000 job cuts in 2025 directly linked to automation, according to new data.

item.title: Trump Escalates a Fight Over How to Measure Merit in American Education
item.description: President Trump’s most recent executive order wades into a debate over how elite colleges should weigh grades and test scores versus the obstacles stu...

item.title: Manhunt Leaves a Montana Town in Limbo a Week After Bar Shooting
item.description: Experts on mass shootings said it’s rare for the gunmen who carry out such crimes to elude the authorities for so long.

item.title: Can Russia’s Economy Withstand Trump’s Threats to Impose Sanctions?
item.description: The Russian economy was slowing even before President Trump’s latest threats. But the Kremlin has enough money to keep fighting in Ukraine.

item.title: TSMC secrets leak puts Japan’s Tokyo Electron on hot seat
item.description: The Japanese company is struggling to address the potential fallout with one of its most important customers and with governments in Tokyo and Taipei.

item.title: Intel CEO dogged by decades of China chip bets, board work
item.description: Donald Trump called Lip-Bu Tan “highly conflicted” in a social media post and urged him to resign.

item.title: The pirate flag from anime ‘One Piece’ is Indonesia’s newest protest symbol—and officials are cracking down
item.description: Officials warn the "provocation"—seen as a protest against President Prabowo's policies—should not fly alongside the country's red-and-white flag.

item.title: Israel Says It’s Preparing to Take Control of Gaza City. What Does That Mean?
item.description: The decision to expand operations in the enclave went against the recommendations of the military.

item.title: The 5 things you need to ‘really create magic’ with AI: the LLM, the context, the prompt, the workflow, and the evaluation
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Cory Mills Should Be at Least as Famous as George Santos
item.description: When you’re MAGA, they let you do it.

item.title: The U.S. Says Britain Is Chilling Free Speech. Many Britons Point the Finger Back.
item.description: To some in the U.K., the criticisms from the American right over arrests of people for hate speech seem hypocritical, given President Trump’s attacks ...

item.title: A Starfish, a President, and a Deep-Sea Frenzy in Argentina
item.description: A livestream of an undersea project has captivated Argentina as President Javier Milei wields a chain saw on the budget for science.

item.title: Ocean Livestream Captivates Argentina Amid Scientific Research Cuts
item.description: As Argentina’s president cut funding for scientific research, hundreds of thousands of people have watched a livestream of a deep sea exploration, par...

item.description: The Russian economy was slowing even before President Trump’s latest threats. But the Kremlin has enough money to keep fighting in Ukraine.
